column4: my friend just installed ubuntu and is getting "Enter help for a list of commands"... what should he do?
sounds like busybox.. aka install is fubar.. try installing again perhaps?
i guess he'll now hate ubuntu.. he'll probably decide to stick with windows now
hmmm.. have only used wubi once, it worked ok for me.. but I've heard horror stories. I assume he can still boot windows and uninstall it?
does the live cd boot ok on his machine? I'd have tested that before doing anything else...
he doesnt have a live cd
does the live cd have an easy install mode for installing along side windows? cuz he would never want to repartition
Oh. well I'm sure he'll be able to boot into windows and add/remove uninstall ubuntu. and he might have better luck playing with the live cd
he'll probably not want to use ubuntu at all now
the live cd can do wubi as well, but if it didn't work this time it probably still won't work
im talking about when you get to the partitioning stage, to have an option to install while retaining windows without all the manual partitioning
yeah, the installer will autoresize windows but I wouldn't entirely trust it.. some OEM installs do 'weird shit' with the disks that confuses the installer and then things can go really wrong.
does it present this option in a nice easy to understand way.... remember this is a windows user that is going to be using this
